content: dreamy seas shawl denise e m bartels pg 1 copyright ©2020 denise e m bartels y arn lace weight i used handspun y ardage approximately 1200 yards n eedles i used us size 1 2 25 mm but i knit very loosely s ize 74 inches by 21 inches t his shawl is a rectangle knit from end to end it has a seed stitch border that you can change to garter if you prefer it looks more complicated than it is the repeated motif is only 18 stitches by 22 row while all the stitches used are basic it is probably not a good first lace project choice because it is not symmetrical t he shawl can easily be made wider or narrower by increasing or decreasing the number of repeats add or subtract increments of 18 stitches to increase or decrease the width to change the length add or subtract the number of repeats of the chart you can even stop after row 24 and proceed to the yarnover row and the seed stitch row to finish up i did 15 repeats because that is how much yarn i had and i wanted to use as much of my handspun as possible pg 2 copyright ©2020 denise e m bartels c ast on 119 stitches k nit 8 row of seed stitch starting and ending with knit stitches r ow 9 k1 p1 k1 p1 k2tog yo until last 7 stitches kfb knit into the front and back of the stitch yo ssk p1 k1 p1 k1 r ow 10 k1 p1 k1 p1 k1 purl until the last 5 stitches k1 p1 k1 p1 k1 k nit dreamy seas chart i knit the chart 15 times but you can knit it as many times as you want -- or until you are almost out of yarn which was my approach a ll even row are k1 p1 k1 p1 k1 purl until the last 5 stitches k1 p1 k1 p1 k1 w hen you are ready to stop knit row 1 of the chart followed by an even row n ext right side row is k1 p1 k1 p1 k2tog yo until the last 6 stitches ssk p1 k1 p1 k1 t hen knit 8 row of seed stitch starting and ending with knit stitches b ind off and block pg 3 copyright ©2020 denise e m bartels pg 4 copyright ©2020 denise e m bartels pg 5 copyright ©2020 denise e m bartels
